title: Meta-Alternating Current
alt: It's always bothered me that you can't cancel out an inverter by putting a second inverter after it.
transcript:
Cursed Connectors #120[Drawing of a chain of rectifiers and inverters. There are seven pairs of rectifiers/inverters. The chain starts on the left with a mains plug (type B), followed by the first rectifier. It ends with the last inverter, and a female mains plug (type B socket).][They are also labelled, by means of the words "rectifiers" and "inverters" with arrows drawn pointing to a few of each. Per the labels, the inverters are the big chunky ones, and the rectifiers are the smaller ones.]Meta-alternating current extension cord
(alternates between AC and DC)
